Empty.description: Empty model. Used as default value when no model is specified.

operations.summary: Gets inventory details for the specified order by it's identifier (order Id).

parameters.name: responseFormat
parameters.description: The response format. If the request has an input body, that body must also use the format specified in "responseFormat". Valid values include "json" and "xml" without the quotes. If the responseFormat isn't specified, the "accept" HTTP header shall be used to determine the format of the response. If the "accept" HTTP header isn't specified as well, the default response format shall be in json.

parameters.name: physicalStoreId
parameters.description: The physical store identifiers. Multiple values are separated by commas. Example: physicalStoreId=10001,10002

responseMessages.message: Bad request. Some of the inputs provided to the request aren't valid.
Not authenticated. The user session isn't valid.
The user isn't authorized to perform the specified request.
If any of the specified order identifiers couldn't be found, or none of the specified online/physical stores exist.
Internal server error. Additional details will be contained on the server logs.

operations.summary: Gets inventory details for the specified product by it's identifier (Catalog Entry Id). Multiple product IDs can be passed to the URI separated by a comma (,).

parameters.name: productIds
parameters.description: The product identifiers. Multiple values are separated by commas. Example: /inventoryavailability/10001,10002

parameters.name: responseFormat
parameters.description: The response format. If the request has an input body, that body must also use the format specified in "responseFormat". Valid values include "json" and "xml" without the quotes. If the responseFormat isn't specified, the "accept" HTTP header shall be used to determine the format of the response. If the "accept" HTTP header isn't specified as well, the default response format shall be in json.

parameters.name: physicalStoreId
parameters.description: The physical store identifiers. Multiple values are separated by commas. Example: physicalStoreId=10001,10002

responseMessages.message: Bad request. Some of the inputs provided to the request aren't valid.
Not authenticated. The user session isn't valid.
The user isn't authorized to perform the specified request.
If any of the specified product identifiers couldn't be found, or none of the specified online/physical stores exist.
Internal server error. Additional details will be contained on the server logs.

operations.summary: Gets inventory details for the specified product by it's identifier (PartNumber). Multiple partNumbers can be passed to the URI separated by a comma (,).

parameters.name: partNumbers
parameters.description: The product identifiers. Multiple values are separated by commas. Example: /inventoryavailability/'AuroraWMDRS-1,'AuroraWMDRS-2

parameters.name: responseFormat
parameters.description: The response format. If the request has an input body, that body must also use the format specified in "responseFormat". Valid values include "json" and "xml" without the quotes. If the responseFormat isn't specified, the "accept" HTTP header shall be used to determine the format of the response. If the "accept" HTTP header isn't specified as well, the default response format shall be in json.

parameters.name: physicalStoreName
parameters.description: The physical store names. Multiple values are separated by commas. Example: physicalStoreName=China mall,Sales mall

parameters.name: forUser
parameters.description: User name to act on behalf of.

parameters.name: forUserId
parameters.description: User identifier to act on behalf of.

responseMessages.message: Bad request. Some of the inputs provided to the request aren't valid.
Not authenticated. The user session isn't valid.
The user isn't authorized to perform the specified request.
If any of the specified product identifiers couldn't be found, or none of the specified online/physical stores exist.

description: This class provides RESTful services to get inventory availability details for products. It performs the service by delegating to the InventoryAvailability BOD service.
